```{r setup, include = FALSE}
library(flexdashboard)
library(maptools)
library(tidyverse)
library(purrr)
library(leaflet)
library(plotly)
library(lipdR)
library(dygraphs)
library(geoChronR)

#read functions
source("../../functions.R")


load("../../temp.Rdata")

#remove columns we don't want to plot
varNames <- sapply(TS, "[[","paleoData_variableName")

# good <- which(!(varNames %in% c("year","depth","age")))
# TS <- TS[good]


#All datasets
dsn <- sapply(TS,"[[","dataSetName")
ui <- which(!duplicated(dsn))
udsn <- dsn[ui]
lat <- as.numeric(sapply(TS,"[[","geo_latitude")[ui])
lon <- as.numeric(sapply(TS,"[[","geo_longitude")[ui])
#elev <- sapply(TS,"[[","geo_elevation")[ui]
archiveType <- sapply(TS,"[[","archiveType")[ui]
link <- paste0(udsn,".html") %>% 
  str_replace_all("'","_")

#Organize metadata for map
map.meta <- data.frame(dataSetName = udsn, #datasetname
                       lat = lat,#lat
                       lon = lon,#lon
                      # elev = elev,#elevation
                       archiveType = factor(archiveType),#archiveType
                       link = link)#Link


#set index number

i = 383
thisTS <- TS[which(udsn[i] == dsn)]
```

<p style="margin-left: 10px"><strong>TSid: </strong>LPDfaa61777t

<p style="margin-left: 10px"><strong>description: </strong>aquatic biomarker
<details>
<summary>interpretation</summary>
<details style="margin-left: 20px">
<summary>1</summary>
<p style="margin-left: 20px"><strong>basis: </strong>As in Pahnke et al., 2007, Paleoceanography: ""in areas of strong contrast between the d D value of precipitation and seawater, and high amounts of rainfall (e.g., in the tropics close to river deltas), any changes in alkenone d D values caused by species or growth rate variations are likely to be secondary to the first order effects caused by freshwater fluxes."
<p style="margin-left: 20px"><strong>interpDirection: </strong>decrease
<p style="margin-left: 20px"><strong>scope: </strong>climate
<p style="margin-left: 20px"><strong>variable: </strong>regional hydrology and river runoff
<p style="margin-left: 20px"><strong>direction: </strong>decrease
</details>
<details style="margin-left: 20px">
<summary>2</summary>
<p style="margin-left: 20px"><strong>basis: </strong>Our results illustrate that changes in atmospheric circulation can trigger changes in precipitation isotopes in a counter-intuitive manner that ultimately impacts surface salinity estimates based on seawater isotopic values.
<p style="margin-left: 20px"><strong>direction: </strong>positive
<p style="margin-left: 20px"><strong>inferredMaterial: </strong>sea surface dD
<p style="margin-left: 20px"><strong>mathematicalRelation: </strong>nonlinear
<p style="margin-left: 20px"><strong>scope: </strong>isotope
<p style="margin-left: 20px"><strong>seasonality: </strong>summer
<p style="margin-left: 20px"><strong>variable: </strong>Salinity
<p style="margin-left: 20px"><strong>coefficient: </strong>NA
<p style="margin-left: 20px"><strong>fraction: </strong>NA
<p style="margin-left: 20px"><strong>rank: </strong>NA

### Sitemap

```{r}
  map.meta.split <- split(map.meta, map.meta$archiveType)


factpal <- colorFactor("Paired",map.meta$archiveType)
buff <- 15
l <- leaflet() %>% 
  addTiles() %>% 
  fitBounds(map.meta$lon[i]-buff,map.meta$lat[i]-buff,map.meta$lon[i]+buff,map.meta$lat[i]+buff)
  

  
  
names(map.meta.split) %>%
  purrr::walk( function(df) {
    l <<- l %>%
      addMarkers(data=map.meta.split[[df]],
                 lng=~lon, lat=~lat,
                 label=~as.character(archiveType),
                 popup=~paste(str_c('Dataset: <a href="',link,'">',dataSetName,'</a>'),
                                 # str_c("Elevation: ",elev),
                                  str_c("Archive Type: ",archiveType),
                                  sep = "<br>"),
                 group = df,
                 clusterOptions = markerClusterOptions(removeOutsideVisibleBounds = F),
                 labelOptions = labelOptions(noHide = F,
                                             direction = 'auto'))
  })

l %>%
  addLayersControl(position = "bottomleft",
    overlayGroups = names(map.meta.split),
    options = layersControlOptions(collapsed = FALSE,
                                   opacity = 0.8)
  )
```
